DataElement.preferredName: Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma EGFR Activating Mutation Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions addressing EGFR activating mutations with regards to NSCLC.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma EGFR Activating Mutation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy._A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.  --2002

Concepts.definition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including non-small cell squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma. Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain.

Concepts.definition: A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a constitutively active 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does NSCLC harbor an EGFR act
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does NSCLC harbor an EGFR activating mutation (Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is prior genotyping positive for an EGFR activating mutation (L858R, Exon 19 deletion, G719X, L861Q)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is activating mutation present in the EGFR gene (L858R or exon 19 deletion, alone or in combination with other EGFR mutations) as per local assessment of a tissue biopsy/cytology specimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: SWOG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been tested for and determined to have EGFR-mutated, MET-amplified NSCLC?
